H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H7390.def: literally: soft of heart; hence: = state in which humans lack courage and decisiveness

H3173.def: = state in which humans are not part of a larger group or community

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

18.gl: to turn (one's) heart (in a certain direction)

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H7075.def: = object that is acquired, whether by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H5549.def: literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H2263.def: = action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love-making

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H3880.def: possible meaning: = flowers or leaves woven together into a ring; ► worn on one's head; ≈ associated with honor and beauty

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H4042.def: = action by which humans transfer possession of something to someone else

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H3476.def: = state in which humans are morally and ethically right

H4570.def: = the impression left by a foot or shoe on the ground

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H3334.def: = causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H833.def: literally: to go forward on a road; hence: = to behave in a certain way

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7847.def: = action by which humans proceed along their way in a different direction than before

H3462.def: = state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H7562.def: = action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H215.def: = process by which something reflects light; ≈ associated with well-being

H5051.def: = process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H653.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and lack of wisdom

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3868.def: literally: (qualities) turn from (someone's) eyes; hence: = process by which people begin to lose active knowledge of certain qualities

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H4832.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4929.def: = state in which people are constantly watched and cannot move about freely

H8444.def: = a place through which one can leave a building or town

H6143.def: literally: crookedness (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H3891.def: = state in which an event lacks integrity

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5227.def: = state in which an object is located on the other side of an object or area

H6079.def: = the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

H3474.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface

H6424.def: literally: to make level (a road or path for someone else); hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to make their journey to life without major obstacles

H4570.def: = the impression left by a foot or shoe on the ground

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
